messages.content: ComfyUI-Path-Helper is a module that provides a set of custom nodes to help with creating file paths for ComfyUI using the Python os library.
What are some features of ComfyUI-Path-Helper?

Some features of ComfyUI-Path-Helper include creating project root folders, adding folders and file prefixes, showing paths or strings in a node, prefixing/postfixing datetime to paths, and formatting variables into paths.
What are some of the nodes available in ComfyUI-Path-Helper?
Some of the nodes available in ComfyUI-Path-Helper are CreateProjectRoot, AddFolder, AddFolderAdvanced, AddFileNamePrefix, AddFileNamePrefixAdvanced, JoinVariables, ShowPath, and ShowString.
How can you format datetime in ComfyUI-Path-Helper?
In ComfyUI-Path-Helper, datetime can be formatted using strftime, which allows for customization of the format. This can be done in the advanced nodes by prefixing or postfixing datetime to a path.
How can you format variables in ComfyUI-Path-Helper?

In ComfyUI-Path-Helper, variables can be formatted using the {} notion within the given string in the advanced nodes. Multiple variables can also be formatted by passing a comma-separated string into 'input_variables' using the Join Variables node.
What is the known issue with the Show Path node in ComfyUI-Path-Helper?

The known issue with the Show Path node in ComfyUI-Path-Helper is that it seems to always hold the first value it receives and then renders a second text window with any updated values, which appears to be related to the PATH being a custom type.
What is the purpose of using the Python os library in ComfyUI-Path-Helper?
The purpose of using the Python os library in ComfyUI-Path-Helper is to ensure that file paths are constructed correctly and work consistently across different operating systems.
